articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Burundian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Burundian President
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Pierre Nkurunziza, president of Burundi, on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the president success in his responsible work for political stability and economic prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Tunisian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Tunisian President
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to Mohamed Al Beji Caid Essebssi, president of the Republic of Tunisia, on Wednesday as regards the recent terrorist attack in Tunisia that took dozens of casualties. 
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the government and people of Tunisia, victims and their bereaved families.
					
					 It affirmed the DPRK's support and solidarity for the efforts of the government and people of Tunisia to oppose terrorism and achieve the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Sends Message of Sympathy to British Foreign Secretary
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Sends Message of Sympathy to British Foreign Secretary
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Wednesday sent a message of sympathy to British Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond as regards terrorist attack in Tunisia that claimed many British lives. 
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the foreign secretary and bereaved families of the victims and reaffirmed the principled stand of the DPRK against all forms of terrorism.

articles.title: Terminal of Pyongyang International Airport Opens
articles.content:
Terminal of Pyongyang International Airport Opens 
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Terminal of Pyongyang International Airport was newly built. 
					 The terminal was built in a modern way from the gatepost to the airport to departure lounge, entry formalities hall, service halls, etc and it has various kinds of service networks necessary for business, public catering, information and medical treatment and all other amenities.
					
					 A ceremony for opening the terminal took place on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Pak Pong Ju, Pak Yong Sik, Ro Tu Chol, officers of units who took part in the construction, soldier-builders, officials in relevant field, employees and their families, officials of commissions, ministries and national institutions who contributed to the construction, officials and other people in Sunan District.
					
					 Pak Pong Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and premier of the DPRK, made an opening speech.
					
					 He said that the terminal is the crystal of the noble loyalty, ardent patriotic will and unremitting efforts of Marshal Kim Jong Un who has been keen to put the aerial transport of the country on a world level true to the intention of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The terminal is an iconic edifice in the Songun era and the proud result brought about by the army and people's devoted fighting spirit, great army-people unity and hot wind of creating a new Korean speed, he noted.

articles.title: Vietnamese Political Party Leader Wishes WPK and Korean People Bigger Successes
articles.content:
Vietnamese Political Party Leader Wishes WPK and Korean People Bigger Successes
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador to Vietnam Kim Chang Il paid a farewell call on Nguyen Phu Trong, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, on June 26.
					 The general secretary wished the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Korean people bigger successes in their struggle for accomplishing the cause of building and defending the country under the guidance of First Secretary Kim Jong Un. He went on:
					
					 We pay deep attention to the fact that the Korean people have registered great successes in their struggle for achieving economic development, improving the people's living standard and defending the country's sovereignty under the leadership of the WPK headed by respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, first secretary, in recent years.
					
					 The party and people of Vietnam always remember the precious support and encouragement the party and people of the DPRK sent to the Vietnamese people in their struggle against the U.S. and for saving the nation and accomplishing the cause of nation-building.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties, two states and two peoples have grown stronger thanks to the foundation and tradition of the friendly relations provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The party, the government and people of Vietnam will attach utmost importance to the traditional, friendly and cooperative relations with the party, government and people of the DPRK and further strengthen them in conformity with the requirement of the new times.

articles.title: DPRK and Russian Young People Meet
articles.content:
DPRK and Russian Young People Meet
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting of youth and students in Pyongyang City and members of the group of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation for tour of the area of Mt. Paektu at the Central Youth Hall on Wednesday.
					 Present there were officials of Pyongyang City Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, youth and students in Pyongyang, members of the above-said touring group led by Yevgeni Lashenko, first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation. 
					
					 Yevgeni Lashenko referred to his fresh experience of the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu on Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 He said he thought Mt. Paektu was a holy land of revolution not only to the Korean people but to the world progressive people. 
					
					 He concluded that the young people of the two countries would cherish the revolutionary spirit of Paektu in their minds and wage a joint struggle against the imperialism.
					
					 The participants in the meeting enjoyed a performance given by the art squad of the Central Committee of the youth league.

articles.title: Jang Jong Hwa Meets Youth and Students in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Jang Jong Hwa Meets Youth and Students in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Jang Jong Hwa, who works at the Chollima District Public Catering Establishment in Nampho City, met with youth and students in Pyongyang at the Central Youth Hall and the Youth Park Open-Air Theatre. 
					 The participants in the meetings warmly congratulated Jang Jong Hwa, being called "girl-mother", who moved all people by displaying the noble virtue and spirit in raising seven orphans like her own flesh and blood. 
					
					 She said it is the most honorable and sacred duty for the youth in the present era to be faithful to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, true to the noble intentions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and this is the true way for making the life of youth worthwhile. 
					
					 Jang noted that she has raised the orphans with the will to repay even a little the great benevolence of the mother Party which brought up and put forward her by bringing her all the happiness in the world. 
					
					 She added that warm hearts of benevolent people who showed deep care for her made her feel once again that the pride of living in the socialist country of a great harmonious family and the worthwhile life of youth is further glorified when one devotes oneself to the society and collective. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the meetings. 
					
					 Present at the meetings were Chairman Jon Yong Nam and other officials of the Central Committee of the youth league and youth and students here.

articles.title: Pakistani Diplomats Give Helping Hands to Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Pakistani Diplomats Give Helping Hands to Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Pakistani Ambassador to the DPRK Syed Hasan Habib and his embassy officials did a friendship labor at the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Taesong Vegetable Co-op Farm in Taesong District, Pyongyang City Wednesday.
					 The guests laid bouquets before the mosaic depicting smiling President Kim Il Sung at the farm and paid tribute to him.
					
					 They were briefed on the farm associated with feats of the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 They helped farmers in weeding a field.
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Tennis Encouraged in DPRK
articles.content:
Tennis Encouraged in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The sports team of Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry in the DPRK directs big efforts to developing the tennis event.
					 The sports team produced a number of excellent tennis players, who proved successful in such national tournaments as the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games and the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize.
					
					 It won more than ten trophies and a lot of gold medals by taking the titles in women's singles, mixed doubles and women's team event of regulation-ball tennis and women's and men's singles and doubles and women's team event of softball tennis.
					
					 In particular, the team has retained the national championship in men's regulation-ball tennis singles from June last year.
					
					 According to its Vice-Director Kim Chang Gil, the sports team has attached priority to tennis after setting it as one of the hopeful events.
					
					 Its goal is to train talented tennis players who will display the honor of the country in international games with gold medals, he said.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Foreign Minister's Jargons
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Foreign Minister's Jargons 
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Yun Pyong Se, south Korean puppet minister of Foreign Affairs, in his recent "opening address" made before foreign riff-raffs malignantly blustered that the nuclear deterrence of the DPRK "would invite only isolation and sanctions" and it is "the most serious challenge." He went the lengths of challenging the DPRK's line of developing the two fronts simultaneously, talking about "gun and butter" and "anachronism."
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What he uttered is an unpardonable act of treachery as it is aimed to label the just nuclear deterrence of the DPRK "illegal" and build up public opinion and escalate international nuclear racket against it in league with outsiders.
					
					 It is foolish, indeed, for the traitor to have disclosed his sinister intention to eliminate the DPRK's nuclear deterrence by letting loose such invectives as "isolation and sanctions" and "the most serious challenge", the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The nuclear deterrence of the DPRK serves as a just shield to firmly protect its supreme interests, security of the nation and peace on the Korean peninsula from the daily increasing U.S. nuclear threat.
					
					 Neither rhetoric nor sanctions nor pressure on the part of hostile forces against the DPRK can ever shake its determination and will.
					
					 The DPRK knows very well which way it should go defying whatever advice from the puppet forces.
					
					 If the puppet authorities persist in the provocations against the DPRK, far from drawing a lesson from their bitter setbacks, they will be held wholly responsible for all the ensuing disasters.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Park Geun Hye Group's Call for Independent "Financial Sanctions" against North
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Park Geun Hye Group's Call for Independent "Financial Sanctions" against North 
 Pyongyang July 1 (KCNA) -- The Park Geun Hye group of south Korea cried out for taking independent "financial sanctions against the north" on June 26 as one step forward in the U.S. and UN "sanctions" against the north under way so far in a bid to "increase pressure upon the north to effect changes."
					 Earlier, the puppet group including Park Geun Hye, the prime minister, the minister of Foreign Affairs and the minister of Unification in their public appearance made one after another let loose a spate of invectives that " the north's wrongdoings should be strongly countered." They made no scruple of slandering the DPRK's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts while talking about "isolation and sanction" and "gun and butter".
					
					 The puppet military warmongers staged once again the test-fire of ballistic missile aimed to "strike all parts of the north" and introduced the U.S. nuclear submarine Michigan into Pusan, bragging that they would turn the "conception of operating the military capability" into the direction of making a preemptive attack upon the north's core facilities.
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary says in this regard:
					
					 The present south Korean situation is, in a word, no more than a scene of carnage of appalling confusion. Upset by this fact, the Park group is working hard to find a way out in the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 It is a foolish daydream for the puppet group try to get rid of the crisis and find a way out in escalating the confrontation with compatriots and igniting a war against the north.
					
					 The Park group's ever more reckless moves to escalate the confrontation with the north would not help find a way out but precipitate its self-destruction. 
					
					 It would be well advised to stop digging its own grave but step down at an early date before facing merciless punishment by history.

articles.title: S. Korean MERS Pandemic Is U.S. Brainchild: Minju Joson
articles.content:
S. Korean MERS Pandemic Is U.S. Brainchild: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The 4th Media, English internet newspaper, carried an article dedicated by a Japanese American newspaper reporter shortly ago.
					 The article cited facts to prove that the MERS pandemic which started in late May in south Korea may have been caused by a laboratory accident at the JUPITR bio-warfare project at Osan U.S. Air Force Base.
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary says the south Korean pandemic can not be construed otherwise than to have originated from Osan U.S. Air Force Base in south Korea, not from the Mid-east.
					
					 Saying that the south Korean MERS has been proved to stand in sharp contrast to the Mid-east MERS, the commentary notes after all this proves that the infection was not caused by a south Korean businessman who had visited a location in the Mid-east.
					
					 The news analyst went on:
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S. Defense Department officially admitted the fact that it brought to Osan U.S. Air Force Base live anthrax germs at a time when MERS-phobia is sweeping across south Korea.
					
					 At the earliest phase of the outbreak, 100 south Korean military personnel were quarantined at the USAF Osan Air Base, following the MERS infection of a serviceman.
					
					 Fearing the disclosure that this actual "Patient Zero" was a victim of its germ weapons development project, the U.S. caused a live anthrax germ delivery case. This reveals its attempt to cover up the whole story of its bio-chemical warfare atrocity.
					
					 All facts vividly prove that the U.S. has long worked hard to make preparations for a bio-chemical warfare on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Unreasonable Suppression Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Unreasonable Suppression Protested
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Members of south Korean civic organizations made public a joint statement on June 29 in protest against the unreasonable suppression by the puppet authorities.
					 The statement said that the security authorities detained Pak Chang Suk, member of an organization, on June 25 on charges of sharing north-related news on website.
					
					 The suppression of the April 16 Solidarity and the detention of Pak are a prelude to a wholesale rule under the pretext of security, it noted.
					
					 It branded the Park Geun Hye regime as the worst regime suppressing the activities for reunification and abusing human rights as it is prolonging its days by invoking the "Security Law."
					
					 It urged the Park Geun Hye regime to repeal at once the "Security Law", and immediately release Pak Chang Suk.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Vows to Struggle till Present Regime Steps down
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Vows to Struggle till Present Regime Steps down
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy held a press conference at Kwanghwamun plaza, Seoul on June 29 in protest against the authorities' fascist crackdown, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo. 
					 At the press conference, the organization recalled that as soon as ill-famous Hwang Kyo An took office as the "prime minister", a new whirlwind of suppression is sweeping south Korea. 
					
					 After issuing a flurry of warrants of arrest and indictments against members of the progressive organization, the security authorities are busy cracking down on members of the Korea Solidarity by sending warrants to them, it charged.
					
					 It declared total objection to the undemocratic and anti-human rights summons to members of the solidarity for their investigation.
					
					 It declared it would take the lead in the courageous struggle till the present regime steps down, fully accountable for all illegal actions and measures.

articles.title: Action for Probing Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster Staged
articles.content:
Action for Probing Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster Staged
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The April 16 Solidarity of south Korea held a meeting at Kwanghwamun plaza of Seoul on June 27 in denunciation of the south Korean puppet authorities' ever more frantic moves to crack down on the organization active for probing the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster. 
					 Speakers said as soon as the new "prime minister" took office, the security authorities issued warrants for search and confiscation in a bid to intensify the suppression of the organization. 
					
					 Through the frantic suppression of bereaved families the authorities try to drive a wedge between the bereaved families and civic organizations, they noted, declaring their will to intensify the struggle for probing the truth behind the ferry disaster. 
					
					 The April 16 Solidarity held the inaugural meeting of the organization in Seoul on June 28. 
					
					 Speakers there expressed the will to make efforts for implementing the four-point tasks such as probing the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster, early salvaging of the sunken ferry, making safe society and promoting the April 16 human rights declaration movement.

articles.title: Foreign Media Laud Kim Jong Il's Party-building Exploits
articles.content:
Foreign Media Laud Kim Jong Il's Party-building Exploits
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign media praised leader Kim Jong Il's exploits in party-building from June 15 to 19 on the 51st anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The Syrian paper Al Baath in an article titled "Ever-victorious WPK and Kim Jong Il" said he was the eternal general secretary of the WPK who made sure the party consistently adhered to the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as its reliable guiding idea.
					
					 Al Nour of Syria carried the similar article.
					
					 Novo Rabotnichesko Delo of Bulgaria carried an article titled "June 19 is a significant day in the DPRK".
					
					 The article said that Kim Jong Il enriched the Juche idea through his extraordinary ideological and theoretical activities. It went on: He pursued the Songun politics to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation and turned the DPRK into an impregnable fortress.
					
					 He made devoted efforts to reunify the country divided by foreign forces.
					
					 Guinean domestic, international and seven national language radios broadcasted an article titled "Eternal general secretary of the WPK" which said it was impossible to think about the victorious and glorious history of the WPK without his exploits.

articles.title: Russian Paper Praises Kim Il Sung as Founder of DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Paper Praises Kim Il Sung as Founder of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 1 ( KCNA) -- The Russian paper Rio Panorama on June 24 carried an article titled "Founder of the DPRK" accompanied with photos showing the exploits of President Kim Il Sung to mark the 21st anniversary of his demise.
					 The paper said Kim Il Sung established a people's revolutionary government on the guerilla base where the right and freedom of the people were ensured during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. Based on this historical experience he put forward a state-building line suiting the specific situation of the country after its liberation and enforced democratic reforms to consolidate the social and economic foundation of new Korea, it noted, adding:
					
					 Under the grave situation due to the U.S. imperialists' occupation of south Korea after the liberation he directed great efforts to rallying the patriotic forces in the north and the south around the banner of national independence and held all-Korea general elections to found the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, the first people's democratic state in the Orient.
					
					 He honorably protected the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK and wisely led socialist construction.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Malaysia
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Malaysia 
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A Malaysian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation was formed with due ceremony at the Dombo Enterprise Company of Malaysia on June 24.
					 At the ceremony Chong Chingchi, manager of the company, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful events from June 24 to October 10.

articles.title: Malaysian Personage on DPRK's Important Days
articles.content:
Malaysian Personage on DPRK's Important Days
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- Liberation of Korea and founding of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) were of great significance to the Korean people for their destiny.
					 This is a remark made by Chong Chingchi, manager of the Dombo Enterprise Company of Malaysia, at the inaugural ceremony of a Malaysian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the WPK on June 24 where he was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 This year marks the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and founding of the WPK, he said.
					
					 He paid highest tribute to President Kim Il Sung who liberated Korea and founded the invincible WPK.
					
					 He continued:
					
					 The President, who was born into a revolutionary and patriotic family in the grim days of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule, embarked upon the road of revolution in his teens.
					
					 He commanded the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory and achieved the cause of liberating the country on August 15, 1945.
					
					 He also founded the WPK, a mass party, on October 10, 1945.

articles.title: DPRK's Principled Stand for Reunification Introduced
articles.content:
DPRK's Principled Stand for Reunification Introduced
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- A British paper carried write-ups and Guinean radios aired special programs on the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The June issue of the British paper Line of March carried an article titled "Efforts for peace on the Korean peninsula, 15th anniversary of historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration" accompanied with a photo showing the exploits leader Kim Jong Il performed for reunification.
					
					  The paper said the DPRK government released a statement on the 15th anniversary of the joint declaration to say that the publication of the joint declaration enabled the north and the south to see a new era in which the half a century-old inter-Korean distrust and confrontation are removed and they go for reconciliation, unity and reunification by their concerted efforts. 
					
					 Great achievements had been made in the movement of Korea's reunification since the publication of the joint declaration, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK has made continuous efforts for the improvement of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The Korean nation will drive the U.S. forces out of south Korea and reunify the country in the near future.
					
					 Guinean domestic radio on June 22 introduced the principled stand of the DPRK working to mend the north-south relations and reunify the country.
					
					 The Guinean international and seven language radios aired the similar program on the same day.

articles.title: U.S. Might Is Not a Cure-all: Russian Paper
articles.content:
U.S. Might Is Not a Cure-all: Russian Paper
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Komsomolskaya Pravda Vladivostok on June 24 carried an article titled "Lesson from Korean War, U.S. Might Is Not a Cure-all" illustrated with a picture of service personnel of the Korean People's Army celebrating the victory of the Fatherland Liberation War on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The article said: 
					
					 June 25, 65 years ago, was the day the U.S. ignited a war against the young DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. introduced huge armed forces in the Korean peninsula and its vicinity and hurled the south Korean puppet army as a shock brigade and bullet-shield. 
					
					 No military and technical superiority of the U.S. could match the might of the army and people of the DPRK who turned out as one, aware of the justice of their own cause. 
					
					 The DPRK has steadily strengthened its capability for self-defence   in every way and had access to nuclear deterrence to cope with the U.S. nuclear threat. 
					
					 Should the U.S. provoke a new war on the Korean peninsula, its mainland will be engulfed in flames.

articles.title: Ethiopian Organization Denounces U.S. and S. Korean Authorities' Anti-Reunification Moves
articles.content:
Ethiopian Organization Denounces U.S. and S. Korean Authorities' Anti-Reunification Moves 
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism made public a statement on June 25 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle. 
					 We send full support to the righteous struggle of the Korean people for reunifying the country on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S., which suffered a bitter defeat in the Korean war, has staged ceaseless war exercises on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity with huge troops for aggression and war hardware deployed in south Korea, escalating the tension to an extreme pitch. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities following the U.S. are making desperate efforts to achieve "unification through absorption," pursuant to the U.S. line. 
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and stop at once joint war exercises for aggression with the south Korean authorities. 
					
					 We strongly demand the south Korean authorities give up the foolish ambition for "unification through absorption" and opt for implementing the north-south joint declarations which the north and the south of Korea agreed upon and the world recognized.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People Expressed by British Organizations
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People Expressed by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, July 1 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK issued a joint statement on June 21 on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
					 The statement said that the U.S. imperialists made indiscriminate air raids on the areas of Korea during the war, perpetrating deliberate and premeditated killings of civilians.
					
					 Recently the U.S. secretly introduced anthrax germs in its forces unit in south Korea, another proof of its plan to kick off a bio-chemical war against the Korean people, it noted, and went on:
					
					 We vehemently accuse the present U.S. administration of refusing to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and strongly urge it to admit its crimes against the Korean people.
					
					 We join the world people in demanding the U.S. unconditionally withdraw its forces from south Korea and immediately stop its military exercises and "human rights" rackets against the DPRK.

articles.title: Inaugurada terminal de Aeropuerto Internacional de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Inaugurada terminal de Aeropuerto Internacional de Pyongyang 
Pyongyang, 1 de julio (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada este miercoles la terminal del Aeropuerto Internacional de Pyongyang, donde estan acondicionados modernamente la jamba del aeropuerto, los halles de espera de salida, de llegada y de servicios y las redes de servicios publicos.
					En la ceremonia de inauguracion participaron Pak Pong Ju, Pak Yong Sik, Ro Tu Chol, los oficiales y constructores militares movilizados a la construccion, los funcionarios interesados, los empleados y sus familiares, los funcionarios de los comites, ministerios y organos centrales que contribuyeron a la obra, los funcionarios y trabajadores del municipio de Suan.
					
					La palabra de inauguracion estuvo a cargo de Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					
					El orador dijo que la terminal del Aeropuerto Internacional de Pyongyang es el fruto de la noble fidelidad, ardiente voluntad patriotica e incansables esfuerzos del Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien hace todo lo posible por elevar al nivel mundial el transporte aereo del pais en acato al proposito del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Dijo que la terminal es el edificio arquitectonico modelo de la era del Songun y refleja el temperamento de lucha de nuestro ejercito y pueblo, la unidad monolitica entre los militares y civiles coreanos y el fervor de creacion de una nueva velocidad de Corea.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia los participantes dieron recorrido por la terminal.

articles.title: Jovenes y estudiantes capitalinos se reunen con Jang Jong Hwa
articles.content:
Jovenes y estudiantes capitalinos se reunen con Jang Jong Hwa
Pyongyang, 1 de julio (ACNC) -- El encuentro entre Jang Jong Hwa, obrera de la empresa de servicio gastronomico publico del municipio de Chollima de ciudad de Nampho, y los jovenes estudiantes de esta capital tuvo lugar, respectivamente, en la Casa Central de la Juventud y en el Anfiteatro del Parque Juv
					ntud.
					
					Ante todo, los participantes felicitaron calurosamente a Jang, quien siendo "muchacha-madre", cuido a los 7 huerfanos con el sentimiento consanguineo poniendo de manifiesto hermosa virtud y noble espiritu y conmoviendo a todos.
					
					En el encuentro, Jang dijo que quedar fiel a la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun en pleno acato al  noble proposito de los grandes Lideres es un deber mas honroso y sagrado de los jovenes de la epoca y he aqui el camino verdadero para glorificar la vida de la juventud.
					
					Recordo que criaba a los huerfanos con el unanime deseo de responder al gran amor del partido madre que formo a ella misma ofreciendole solo la felicidad.
					
					Enfatizo que la vida preciosa de la juventud brillara mas cuando se sacrifique para la sociedad y la comunidad.
					
					Luego hubo intervenciones.
					
					Al acto asistieron el presidente del Comite Central del la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, Jon Yong Nam, y otros funcionario junto con los jovenes y estudiantes en la capital.
